thread.title: Mounties Albano gets 1,000th assist, leads sweep of Pittsfield
thread.title_full: Mounties Albano gets 1,000th assist, leads sweep of Pittsfield

author:
Berkshire Eagle Staff
sports@berkshireeagle.com @EagleSportsZone on Twitter
title: Mounties Albano gets 1,000th assist, leads sweep of Pittsfield
text:
Mounties Albano gets 1,000th assist, leads sweep of Pittsfield 
Berkshire Eagle Staff Posted: 10/21/2015 10:29:57 PM EDT Updated: 10/21/2015 10:48:26 PM EDT 
WILLIAMSTOWN >> Mount Greylock's Dagny Albano directed the offense with well-placed passes, dishing out 21 assists and leading the Mounties to a 25-21, 25-17 and 25-22 sweep of Pittsfield in girls high school volleyball on Wednesday. 
Albano passed 1,000 career assists against the Generals. She has 436 this season and 1,009 overall. 
Jenna Benzinger added 10 blocks. Hope Willis had nine kills and Serena Chow added three aces and eight kills. 
Riley Nichols led Pittsfield with 18 assists. Michaela LeBlanc had eight kills and three aces. Nicole LaPierre added two kills and four digs, Boys Soccer 
MOUNT EVERETT 3, MCCANN TECH 0 
In Sheffield, a Nick Tomich penalty kick jump-started Mount Everett's offense, leading to a commanding win over McCann Tech. 
Tomich converted the penalty kick in the 18th minute. Dan Litchfield and Brendan Dempsey added insurance goals as well. 
Ryan Meyer made three saves, keeping the clean sheet. Everett moves to 10-2-3. 
"Nick converted the PK and it really changed the tide," Everett coach Josh King said. "We weren't playing with much enthusiasm and we weren't playing our best to that point. ... [After the PK] we picked it up and played with more confidence." 
——— ME — Nick Tomich (penalty kick), 17:14. ME — Dan Litchfield (Tomich), 34:30 
Second Half 
ME — Brendan Dempsey (UA), 45: 00. 
Saves — MT: Nico Moreno 8. ME: Ryan Meyer 3. 
FRONTIER 3, MOUNT GREYLOCK 0 
In Williamstown, Frontier broke a scoreless first-half tie with three second-half goals in nine minutes, handing Mount Greylock's second loss of the season. 
Greylock did not generate much offense, as Frontier keeper Dylan Husted did not make a save during the shutout. 
Connor Hamilton, Chad Parent and Andy Habel scored for Frontier. 
"Frontier is an excellent team and beat us in all facets of the game today," Greylock coach Blair Dils said. 
——— 0 
Second Half F — Connor Hamilton (Chad Parent), 49:00. F — Parent (Hamilton), 54:00. F — Andy Habel (Dylan Landry), 58:00. Saves — F: Dylan Husted 0. MG — Cal Filson 2. Cross Country 
In Cheshire, the Lenox girls cross country team continued its dominant season, while Tommy Kirby and the Mount Greylock boys also ended their regular season on a high note. 
Kirby finished first overall in 16 minutes and 8 seconds. Greylock placed eight runners in the top 10. Jared Haley led Hoosac Valley, placing third in 17:18. Jaryd Massaro was Wahconah's top finisher (10th, 18:22). Harry Bruns led Lenox (11th, 18:34). 
Greylock's Margo Smith finished first overall in 18:55. Maggie Sorrentino led Lenox, placing second in 19:03. The Millionaires placed seven runners in the top 10. 
Jamie Barth led Hoosac, placing sixth in 21:08. Gabrielle Orlando led Wahconah (11th, 21:22).
